intro: Noronhia rollandii, commonly known as the Cape rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, round fruits that turn red when mature. Noronhia rollandii is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils. It prefers full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
